casebody.data:
UNITED STATES of America, Plaintiff-Appellee, v. Benjamin Shane FOSTER, a.k.a. Benjamin Shawn Foster, Defendant-Appellant. No. 08-15000

Non-Argument Calendar.

United States Court of Appeals, Eleventh Circuit. June 10, 2009. Benjamin Shane Foster, Union Springs, AL, pro se. *552Matthew W. Shepherd, Montgomery, AL, for Plaintiff-Appellee. Before BIRCH, HULL and KRAVITCH, Circuit Judges. PER CURIAM:

John Carlton Taylor, appointed counsel for Benjamin Shane Foster in this direct criminal appeal, has moved to withdraw from further representation of the appellant and filed a brief prepared pursuant to Anders v. California, 386 U.S. 738, 87 S.Ct. 1396, 18 L.Ed.2d 493 (1967). Because independent examination of the entire record reveals no arguable issues of merit, counsel’s motion to withdraw is GRANTED, and Foster’s conviction and sentence are AFFIRMED.
